meanings.definition: The act of adjusting or adapting again.
meanings.sent1: After the move, the readjustment of the furniture took some time.
meanings.sent2: The readjustment of the clock was necessary to make it run accurately.
meanings.sent3: The readjustment of the seating arrangement caused a bit of confusion at the party.
meanings.sent4: His readjustment to the new school was like learning to ride a bike all over again.
meanings.sent5: The readjustment of the sails helped the boat catch the wind more efficiently.

meanings.definition: A change or modification made to something in order to improve or correct it.
meanings.sent1: The readjustment of the recipe resulted in a tastier dish.
meanings.sent2: The readjustment of the budget allowed for more savings in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The readjustment of the plan made everyone realize how much better it could be.
meanings.sent4: Her readjustment of the painting transformed it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The readjustment of the strategy led to a significant increase in productivity.
